metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6759 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
The bfd_get_debug_link_info_1 function in opncls.c in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30, has an unchecked strnlen operation. Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a crafted ELF file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6759` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-common - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-for-build - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-for-host - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-multiarch - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-source - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
libbinutils - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
libctf0 - 2.31.1-6ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.31.1-6ubuntu1').
